Class ec.ifc.app.ECChecklist 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.ListView
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECChecklist
public class ECChecklist
extends ListView
A subclass of ListView that marks selected items with a checkmark image. A mouse click on a row toggles the selection of that row.
See Also:
ECChecklistOwner

ECChecklist()
Constructs an ECChecklist with background color Color.lightGray that allows multiple and empty selections, and that uses IFC's standard checkmark image.

getCheckedImage()
Returns the image drawn next to checked items.
getOwner()
Returns the object that gets notified when the user clicks on an item.
getUncheckedImage()
Returns the image drawn next to unchecked items.
mouseDown(MouseEvent)
If this checklist is disabled, does nothing.
setBackgroundColor(Color)
Keeps the prototype item's selected color the same as the background color, so checked items are not drawn with a different color than unchecked items.
setCheckedImage(Image)
Sets the image used to draw the check marks.
setOwner(ECChecklistOwner)
Sets which object will get notified when the user clicks on an item.
setUncheckedImage(Image)
Sets the image drawn next to unchecked items.
toggleItem(ListItem)
Flip the selected state of item, and notify owner.
toggleItemAt(int)
Flip the selected state of the item at index, and notify owner.

ECChecklist 
  public ECChecklist()
Constructs an ECChecklist with background color Color.lightGray that allows multiple and empty selections, and that uses IFC's standard checkmark image.

setBackgroundColor 
  public void setBackgroundColor(Color newColor)
Keeps the prototype item's selected color the same as the background color, so checked items are not drawn with a different color than unchecked items. Does the same for all existing items.
Overrides:
setBackgroundColor in class ListView
getCheckedImage 
  public Image getCheckedImage()
Returns the image drawn next to checked items. By default this is IFC's built-in check mark image.
See Also:
setCheckedImage
getUncheckedImage 
  public Image getUncheckedImage()
Returns the image drawn next to unchecked items. By default this is null.
See Also:
setUncheckedImage
setCheckedImage 
  public void setCheckedImage(Image newImage)
Sets the image used to draw the check marks.
See Also:
getCheckedImage
setUncheckedImage 
  public void setUncheckedImage(Image newImage)
Sets the image drawn next to unchecked items.
See Also:
getUncheckedImage
mouseDown 
  public boolean mouseDown(MouseEvent event)
If this checklist is disabled, does nothing. Otherwise, toggles the checked state of the clicked item and, if this checklist has an owner, calls ECChecklistOwner.itemWasToggled on the owner.
Overrides:
mouseDown in class ListView
See Also:
itemWasToggled
toggleItemAt 
  public boolean toggleItemAt(int index)
Flip the selected state of the item at index, and notify owner. Returns whether or not the item ends up selected.
toggleItem 
  public boolean toggleItem(ListItem item)
Flip the selected state of item, and notify owner. Returns whether or not the item ends up selected.
getOwner 
  public ECChecklistOwner getOwner()
Returns the object that gets notified when the user clicks on an item.
See Also:
setOwner
setOwner 
  public void setOwner(ECChecklistOwner newOwner)
Sets which object will get notified when the user clicks on an item.
See Also:
getOwner
